snippet: A cold war-era satellite relay station is for sale in California after a Silicon Valley mogul gave up on plans to turn it into a weekend home.
abstract: Jamesburg Earth Station, a satellite relay base from the 1960s that was built to survive a nuclear attack, is for sale in California after a Silicon Valley mogul gives up on plans to turn it into a weekend home; is a $3 million tech-lover’s paradise on 161 acres equipped with a 97-foot satellite dish.
lead_paragraph: A cold war-era satellite relay station is for sale in California after a Silicon Valley mogul gave up on plans to turn it into a weekend home.

headline.seo: Jamesburg Earth Station Can Be Yours for $3 Million
headline.main: 21,000 Square Feet of Cold War Memories for Sale, Satellite Dish Included
headline.print_headline: Hello, Out There. Jamesburg Earth Station Is for Sale.
